member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicy
member.summary: Represents the antispoofing policy for a user.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicy.Action
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to take for the antispoofing policy.

member.name: P:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicy.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the antispoofing policy.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicyAction
member.summary: Specifies the types of actions you take for the antispoofing policy of a user.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicyAction.Disable
member.summary: Turns off the detection of spoofing for a biometric factor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicyAction.Enable
member.summary: Turns on the detection of spoofing for a biometric factor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AntiSpoofPolicyAction.Remove
member.summary: Removes the entire antispoofing policy for the biometric factor from the account.

summary.para: Defines constants that specify how completion notifications for asynchronous operations are to be delivered to the client application.
This API supports the product infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncNotificationMethod.NotifyNone
member.summary: The operation is synchronous.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncNotificationMethod.NotifyCallback
member.summary: The client-implemented PWINBIO_ASYNC_COMPLETION_CALLBACK function is called by the framework.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncNotificationMethod.NotifyMessage
member.summary: The framework sends completion notices to the client application window message queue.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncNotificationMethod.NotifyMaximumValue
member.summary: The maximum enumeration value. This constant is not directly used by the WinBioAsyncOpenFramework and WinBioAsyncOpenSession.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncResult
member.summary: The class contains the results of an asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets the error code returned by the operation.

member.summary: Gets the handle of an asynchronous session started by calling the function.

member.summary: Gets type of the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets the data that contain additional information about the success or failure of asynchronous operations begun by the client application.

member.summary: Gets the sequence number of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncResult.Session
member.summary: Gets the handle of an asynchronous session started by calling the function.

member.summary: Gets the system date and time at which the biometric operation began.

member.summary: Gets the numeric unit identifier of the biometric unit that performed the operation.

member.name: P:WinBiometricDotNet.AsyncResult.UserData
member.summary: Gets the address of an optional buffer supplied by the caller.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities
member.summary: Specifies the capabilities of biometric sensor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Sensor
member.summary: The device can collect biometric data.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Matching
member.summary: The device can perform match operations.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Database
member.summary: The sensor contains an onboard database.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Proccessing
member.summary: The device can process samples and turn them into biometric templates.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Encryption
member.summary: The device supports encryption of samples and templates.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Navigation
member.summary: The device can be used as a navigation device. Some devices and drivers can capture data in a format that can be translated by a user-mode application into navigation events, much like a mouse.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.Indicator
member.summary: The device has an indicator that can be turned on or off.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricCapabilities.VirtualSensor
member.summary: The sensor adapter manages its own connection to the biometric hardware.

member.summary: Gets a type about the characteristics of the database.

member.summary: Gets a GUID that identifies the format of the templates in the database.

member.name: P:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricDatabase.FilePath
member.summary: Gets the path and file name of the database if it resides on the computer disk.

member.summary: The pool type is unknown.

member.summary: Specifies a shared collection of biometric units managed by the service provider.

member.summary: Specifies a collection of biometric units that are managed by the caller.

member.summary: Reserved.

member.summary: The sensor sub types is not known.

member.summary: The sensor supports fingerprint swipes.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricSensorSubType.Touch
member.summary: The sensor supports finger touches.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures iris data.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures retina data.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures hand data.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures keystrokes.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures thermal face imaging.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures thermal hand imaging.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures foot prints.

member.summary: The biometric sensor captures password data.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.EventTypes
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the types of service provider event notifications to monitor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.EventTypes.Unclaimed
member.summary: The sensor detected a finger swipe that was not requested by the application or by the window that currently has focus. The Windows Biometric Framework calls into your callback function to indicate that a finger swipe has occurred but does not try to identify the fingerprint.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.EventTypes.UnclaimedIdentify
member.summary: The sensor detected a finger swipe that was not requested by the application or by the window that currently has focus. The Windows Biometric Framework attempts to identify the fingerprint and passes the result of that process to your callback function.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the type of asynchronous operation being performed.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.None
member.summary: No operation has been identified.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.Open
member.summary: A biometric session was opened.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.Close
member.summary: A biometric session was closed.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.Verify
member.summary: A biometric sample was verified against a user identity.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.Identify
member.summary: A biometric sample was captured and compared to an existing template.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.LocateSensor
member.summary: The ID number of a biometric unit was retrieved.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnrollBegin
member.summary: A biometric enrollment sequence was initiated.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnrollCapture
member.summary: A biometric sample was captured and added to the template.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnrollCommit
member.summary: A pending biometric template was finalized.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnrollDiscard
member.summary: A pending biometric template was discarded.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnumEnrollments
member.summary: The sub-factors for a given template were enumerated.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.DeleteTemplate
member.summary: A biometric template was deleted from the store.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.CaptureSample
member.summary: A biometric sample was captured.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.GetProperty
member.summary: A biometric session, unit, or template property was retrieved.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.SetProperty
member.summary: A biometric session, unit, template, or account property was set.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.GetEvent
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.LockUnit
member.summary: A biometric unit was locked for exclusive use by a session.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.UnlockUnit
member.summary: The session lock on a biometric unit was released.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.ControlUnit
member.summary: Vendor defined operations were performed on a control unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.ControlUnitPrivileged
member.summary: Privileged vendor defined operations were performed on a control unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.OpenFramework
member.summary: A handle to the biometric framework was opened.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.CloseFramework
member.summary: A handle to the biometric framework was closed.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnumServiceProviders
member.summary: The installed biometric service providers were enumerated.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnumBiometricUnits
member.summary: The attached biometric units were enumerated.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.EnumDatabases
member.summary: The registered databases were enumerated.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.UnitArrival
member.summary: A biometric unit was created.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.OperationType.UnitRemoval
member.summary: A biometric unit was deleted.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.PolicySource
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the possible sources of policy information for the detection of spoofing for biometric factors.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PolicySource.Unknown
member.summary: The source of the policy is unknown.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PolicySource.Default
member.summary: The policy is the default policy that the Windows Biometric Framework provides.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PolicySource.Local
member.summary: The policy that the individual user set for their account by using the Settings app. This policy overrides the default policy.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PolicySource.Admin
member.summary: A group policy that the IT administrator set for the enterprise. Individual users cannot override this policy.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the property to be queried.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.SampleHint
member.summary: Estimates the maximum number of good biometric samples that are required to complete an enrollment template.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.ExtendedSensorInfo
member.summary: Contains extended information about the capabilities and attributes of the sensor component that is connected to a specific biometric unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.ExtendedEngineInfo
member.summary: Contains extended information about the capabilities and attributes of the engine component that is connected to a specific biometric unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.ExtendedStorageInfo
member.summary: Contains extended information about the capabilities and attributes of the storage component that is connected to a specific biometric unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.ExtendedEnrollmentStatus
member.summary: Contains extended information about the status of an in-progress enrollment on a specific biometric unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyId.AntiSpoofPolicy
member.summary: Contains the values of the antispoofing policy for a specific user account.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyType
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the source of the property information.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyType.Session
member.summary: The property applies to a specific biometric session.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyType.Unit
member.summary: The property applies to a specific biometric template.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyType.Template
member.summary: The property applies to a specific biometric unit.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.PropertyType.Account
member.summary: The property applies to a specific user account that has a biometric enrollment.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the reason a biometric fingerprint capture or identification procedure did not succeed.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooHigh
member.summary: The finger scan began too high on the finger.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooLow
member.summary: The finger scan began too low on the finger.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooLeft
member.summary: The finger was too far left during scanning.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooRight
member.summary: The finger was too far right during scanning.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooFast
member.summary: The finger was swiped too quickly on the sensor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooSlow
member.summary: The finger was swiped too slowly on the sensor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintPoorQuality
member.summary: The scan quality was too poor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooSkewed
member.summary: The finger did not pass straight across the sensor.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintTooShort
member.summary: Not enough of the finger was scanned.

member.name: F:WinBiometricDotNet.RejectDetail.FingerprintMergeFailure
member.summary: The fingerprint captures could not be combined.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.ControlUnit(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,System.UInt32,WinBiometricDotNet.Component,System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.IntPtr@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Allows the caller to perform vendor-defined control operations on a biometric unit.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
The value that identifies the biometric unit.
The value that specifies the component within the biometric unit that should perform the operation.
The value that specifies the vendor-defined code recognized by the biometric unit.
The buffer that contains the control information sent to the adapter by the component.
The buffer that receives information sent by the adapter specified by the parameter.
A size, in bytes, of the data written to the buffer specified by the parameter.
The value that specifies the vendor-defined status code that specifies the outcome of the control operation.

The value that specifies the vendor-defined code recognized by the biometric unit.
The buffer that contains the control information sent to the adapter by the component.
The buffer that receives information sent by the adapter specified by the parameter.
A size, in bytes, of the data written to the buffer specified by the parameter.
The value that specifies the vendor-defined status code that specifies the outcome of the control operation.

member.summary: Causes a fast user switch to the account associated with the last successful identification operation performed by the biometric session.

member.returns: true if the function has the switched to the account associated with the last successful identification operation performed by the biometric session; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.MonitorPresence(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Turns on the face-recognition or iris-monitoring mechanism for the specified biometric unit.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
The identifier of the biometric unit for which you want to turn on the face-recognition or iris-monitoring mechanism.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.OpenFramework(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Opens a handle to the biometric framework.
member.param: The buffer supplied by the caller.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.OpenFramework(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Opens a handle to the biometric framework.
member.param: The handle of the window that will receive the completion notices.
The window message code the framework must send to signify completion notices.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.OpenSession
member.summary: Connects to a biometric service provider and one or more biometric units.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.OpenSession(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Connects to a biometric service provider and one or more biometric units.
member.param: The buffer supplied by the caller.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.OpenSession(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Connects to a biometric service provider and one or more biometric units.
member.param: The handle of the window that will receive the completion notices.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.RegisterEventMonitor(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,WinBiometricDotNet.EventTypes)
member.summary: Starts to receive event notifications from the service provider associated with an open session.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
A value that specifies the types of events to monitor.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.ReleaseFocus
member.summary: Releases window focus.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.RemoveAllCredentials
member.summary: Removes all credentials from the store.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.RemoveAllDomainCredentials
member.summary: Removes all user credentials for the current domain from the store.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.RemoveCredential(WinBiometricDotNet.BiometricIdentity,WinBiometricDotNet.CredentialTypes)
member.summary: Deletes a biometric logon credential for a specified user.
member.param: A that contains the SID of the user account for which the logon credential will be removed.
A that specifies the credential type.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.SelectEnroll(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Specifies the individual that you want to enroll when data that represents multiple individuals is present in the sample buffer.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
The value that identifies that individual that you want to select for enrollment.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.SetCredential(WinBiometricDotNet.CredentialTypes,System.Byte[],WinBiometricDotNet.CredentialFormat)
member.summary: Saves a biometric logon credential for the current user.
member.param: A that specifies the credential type.
The buffer that contains the credential.
A that specifies the format of the credential.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.UnlockUnit(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Releases the session lock on the specified biometric unit.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
The value that specifies the biometric unit to unlock.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.UnregisterEventMonitor(WinBiometricDotNet.Session)
member.summary: Cancels event notifications from the service provider associated with an open biometric session.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.Verify(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,WinBiometricDotNet.FingerPosition)
member.summary: Captures a biometric sample and determines whether the sample corresponds to the specified user identity.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
A that specifies the sub-factor associated with the biometric sample.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.VerifyWithCallback(WinBiometricDotNet.Session,WinBiometricDotNet.FingerPosition)
member.summary: Asynchronously captures a biometric sample and determines whether the sample corresponds to the specified user identity.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.
A that specifies the sub-factor associated with the biometric sample.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometric.Wait(WinBiometricDotNet.Session)
member.summary: Blocks caller execution until all pending biometric operations for a session have been completed or canceled.
member.param: A that identifies an open biometric session.

member.name: T:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometricException
member.summary: The exception is general exception for Windows Biometric Framework. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometricException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:WinBiometricDotNet.WinBiometricException.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
member.param: HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
